hypothesis_content.title: Negative News Resolution via Options Skew Normalization
hypothesis_content.statement: When significant negative news (e.g., regulatory, macro) spikes BTC 25-delta skew to >+15 (extreme put premium), and price stabilizes within ±1.5% over the next 8 hours, the normalization of skew toward neutral (0 to +5) will be accompanied by a relief rally of +2-3.5% as hedges are rolled off and volatility sellers re-enter.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extreme skew indicates panic hedging and fear premium. When price stabilizes despite negative news, it suggests the worst-case scenario is priced in. As hedgers roll/close positions, volatility premium collapses, creating upward pressure on spot from short gamma covering and renewed risk appetite.
entry_conditions: BTC price range (high-low) < 2% over 8h following news
Spot volume declines to <70% of 24h average (panic subsiding)
Term structure remains upward sloping (contango) in futures

exit_conditions.take_profit: Skew declines to <+7.5 OR price +3% from entry
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Skew expands further to >+20 OR price breaks below 8h low by >1.5%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If skew remains elevated (>+12) despite price stability beyond 24h, indicating persistent structural fear rather than transient panic.
